result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas L Heckel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment of $100 fine + costs + service fees + Domestic Violence Surcharge + DNA surcharge = $864 due with Count 2 at a rate of $100 per mth comm 10-15-22 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Payment of costs + service fees + DNA surcharge = $443 due with Count 1 at a rate of $100 per mth comm 10-15-22 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
With good time and Huber release if in compliance with jails rules and regulations.

records.addlTxt:
9:29 AM Defendant Nickolas L Heckel in court.  Attorney Mark Douglas Skvara in court for Nickolas L Heckel.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Skvara - plea today, provided paperwork.
DA provides Statement of Read-in also.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty Skvara agrees.
DA reads charge Count 1.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters n/c plea.
DA reads charge Count 2.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters n/c plea.
Victim Rights Compliance.
Non-citizen advisory.
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Statement of Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Atty Skvara - satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts pleas and finds Deft guilty in Counts 1 & 2.
Court dismisses and reads-in add'l counts in Statement of Read-ins.
DA heard on sentencing.
Atty Skvara heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on victim impact statement filed.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes: 
Count 1: Payment of $100 fine + costs + service fees + Domestic Violence Surcharge + DNA surcharge = $864.
Count 2: Payment of costs + services fees + DNA surcharge = $443.
10 days jail w/good time and Huber if in compliance w/jail rules and regulations.  Deft to report to jail 10-11-22 by 7:00 pm.
1 day credit.
Financials due at a rate of $100 per mth comm 10-15-22 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
DNA sample due 10-11-22.
Appeal rights.
9:49 am

10:29 AM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nickolas L Heckel in court.  Attorney Mark Douglas Skvara appeared by Zoom for Nickolas L Heckel. 
Court calls case
Atty Skvara is being heard - case is not resolved yet but requests Plea date
DA has no objection
Court schedules plea
10:34 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter to Judge from Atty Skvara re: Zoom

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nickolas L Heckel in court.  Attorney Mark Douglas Skvara in court for Nickolas L Heckel. 
Court calls case. 
Copy of compliant. 
Deft understands charges and penalties. 
Waives formal readings. 
Enters NG Plea.
Court schedules with parties. 
1:03 PM
Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
